metadata.title: CVE-2012-4430 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The dump_resource function in dird/dird_conf.c in Bacula before 5.2.11 doesnot properly enforce ACL rules, which allows remote authenticated users toobtain resource dump information via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bacula - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-bscan - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-client - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-common - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-common-mysql - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-common-pgsql - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-common-sqlite3 - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-console - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-console-qt - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-director - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-director-mysql - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-director-pgsql - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-director-sqlite3 - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-fd - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-sd - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
bacula-server - 5.2.6+dfsg-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bacula package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.6+dfsg-4').
